c4QmD25RKIJRxvxqNuV2GQ.text: Honestly, I'm saddened to even have to post this but other consumers should be aware. I ordered pizza from this location through an online app, as I have done on numerous occasions. Due to no fault of the business or myself, the order appeared on the company's end a little odd...for example there were essentially no toppings for a create your own pizza. Upon following up to investigate this issue, the lady who answered the phone indicated that it did seem weird. If the order seemed weird, why not call the consumer? Irregardless a pizza was delivered...a pizza that did not match what was ordered nor did it match the order the company actually received! Where then did they come up with what to put on my pizza?  Again, a simple call to the consumer could have avoided this issue. Upon discussing the matter further with the person who answered my call, I asked if I could get a replacement pizza (ie what I had originally ordered). Initially she said yes but then indicated that I could purchase another pizza and would have to resolve the refund issues with the delivery service separately. This seemed so confusing...especially since they made an incorrect pizza irregardless of the system error on the part of the delivery service. It's my understanding, the company gets money for the food ordered since a separate fee applies to the delivery. If a company gets your money for a pizza, I don't think it's too much to ask for the pizza you ordered.

wy5ubIalEHrrKB40L910Bg.text: Uncle Maddio's is a really good spot. It took over that location in King's Dr that used to be a Caribbean joint. The people in there are great. They greet you when you step in the place and are real helpful if you're a newbie like me. I went during lunch so the prices were really good. Nice crowd but not too packed. I guess the secret isn't out yet. Check this place out.

XliVbgkuYY7yJGiO2wSdnA.text: My boyfriend and i ended up here by coincidence. We were looking for another pizza place that was supposedly in the same area but couldnt find it. We saw this place from the road and decided to try it. We are so glad we did. I love the whole wheat crust and the smiling staff! We will definitely be back soon!

t7ulMr7RU0nETsh-o9qQVA.text: We were hoping to have pizza at Mama Ricotta's, but there was a king waiting list to be seated.  So, we decided to try Uncle Maddio's which we passed on our way to Mana Ricotta's.  We were a bit apprehensive about going in since there were only a few people in the restaurant.  Once we had ordered our pizza we were showered with attention and a welcome from all the staff.  We ordered The Big Max.  It was delicious and the sausage was especially tasty,  The assistant manager was very kind and checked in with us to see if everything was okay.  We also enjoyed the local beer that was on tap.  We hope to go back again soon.

i5UiPMxZi0DbYkuofVv4bw.text: We ordered takeout from Maddio's tonight online. The pizzas were hot and ready as I walked through the door, and the staff were great. 5 stars go to the staff, but here I'm commenting mainly on the food.  The pizzas were good, however not great. Toppings were plentiful, but scattered - I really prefer crumbled Italian sausage rather than sliced for one, because you can spread it all over the pie as opposed to sliced, where you may or may not get the sausage in each bite. Same goes for the artichoke. Giant chunks of artichoke were on the pizza, but rather scattered - either you get a giant hunk of artichoke in a bite or you get none at all. This may be all in growing pains, and may be perfected once the newness wears off.  With the plethora of similar "build your own" pizza chains entering the Charlotte market, I just wasn't all that impressed when compared to the others. Blaze Pizza is the winner in my book. Not only did I enjoy their pizza more, but they offer unlimited toppings, where you only get 3 without paying extra at Uncle Maddio's. The reason that I give this place three stars is because it's going to be hard to convince me to return here instead of going to Blaze, which essentially is the same type of pizza place, but with a real fired pizza oven rather than a conveyor cooker and more generous toppings that are more evenly spread on the pizza (oh, and there's that spicy marinara at Blaze that is amazing!).  I wouldn't avoid this place by all means, though. Still a good pie - just doesn't quite stack up to the competition IMHO.  Now if only we could score an &pizza location from DC, I'd be in heaven.

3at1muB-UnrkFkczvoD2GA.text: I had the Big Max pizza very delicious. But what earned them the the 5 stars was the exceptional friendly fast service. I love southern hospitality.

DUaZPQVb_9E_jcfq7uZMrA.text: Went yesterday it was very good. I had steak and black olives pizza. Staff very helpful. Will definitely go again

D8T8jCBA_ADECf2fTlrpMA.text: Went there for dinner, group of 7. Very good hand made pizzas. We had a build your own pizza. Great variety of toppings . Highly recommended.  Owner and staff are very welcoming. We had a group of seven but had our pizzas made and at our table in about 10 minutes. We came late near closing but owner did not rush us ... Just a great dining experience. ..

7RrVdhF4Qaiae0mKduivRA.text: i had a late lunch early dinner there I had the margherita pizza witch was really good . the cashier was really nice he told me that he was glade I was there for my first time eating there . I will be deftly be going back for the good food and friendly survive.

ui0p50QHqXPaRbd2G9cwgw.text: I love Maddios pizza DEFINTLY my favorite and the reg employees r always nice. But at this location we went last night and a female manager was working at around 9pm. Just had horrible attitude towards customers and her employees. Needs to be retrained everyone else was amazing. Food was fast and awesome as always.

__XGd7UY_PoNwehPANVyuQ.text: It is definitely served with love.  I mixed the garlic olive oil with tomato basil and omg!!! The service was friendly. I will be back!

mQV85i8Oo_PsdjJ5UIZ99g.text: Good, reliable pizza that's served quickly with most any topping you'd ever want.  My kids love the "Moe's like" approach to customizing their pizzas.  Only real con is size of restaurant .. It's a tad small but not a big deal.  Good local beers on tap as well.

QYtotMaGlc1ZPCK0v1iAow.text: I walked in and it was apparent how things worked there was a large sign with the menu, over what seemed to be a food making station, and smiling faces greeting us.   I'm huge on Customer Service so this immediately made me feel like this was going to be a good experience.   The little one got a kids meal with just cheese so nothing too fancy, he ate all of it and a cookie which was impressive it was kinda big for a kids pizza.   I was super confused about what to order salad, pizza, flatbread thingy, there was so many choices. The chick behind the counter suggested the special which was a personal pizza for like five bucks.   I got prosciutto, sausage, and sun-dried tomatoes.   My bill was 20 bucks, I don't know how, I got a five dollar deal and a five dollar kids meal, and then the two cookies and my medium drink was another 10 bucks?!? I'm sure it's right, the cookies were huge. It threw me off a little, but I was getting hangry, and my kid was annoying the hell out of me so I just paid, I'm normally that annoying person who questions b/c I've noticed people get rung up incorrectly a lot!    We took our little number & my cup, his milk, & our cookies and found a spot in the cramped dining area. It's not really cramped per se but the booth are really spacious, but the aisle space it's sort of tight when more than one person is walking down.   There's a drink machine with Coke products and all your flatware, napkins, lemons, and lids & straws.   It was really clean and I like the ambience. It was upbeat and there was a good mix of people but the wait was like no time at all.   The pizza was fantastic! It came out piping hot the sauce was absolutely phenomenal I could taste the spices. It was almost like I had made it at my house myself. There was plenty of toppings and cheese. And let me tell you about these cookies! They were huge, tasted amazing, perfectly baked, and had the right amount of morsels! We got a chocolate chip, and oatmeal w/ white chocolate chips & crasins.   Overall great experience, we'll go back next time I make a Trader Joe trip because the salads looked great!!   They do say to order online to skip the wait which I might do next time that way I can look at the menu too.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States. Specials
Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half eaten cookies... So good
Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States. Build your own and a kids cheese

6tDfyeO1BPvkcpiLaFLiGg.text: Horrible customer service, from the OWNER at that. Completely messed up my order twice, never apologized and overcharged me. Trust me, avoid at all costs!

UiYCRyjj3314BAmQlbpt6A.text: Happened across this place on Yelp while visiting Charlotte for a business trip. The food is AWESOME! We ordered several different individual pizzas and all enjoyed what we got. The crusts are on the thinner side but not too thin. They are generous with toppings and flavors and will customize just how you like it. We used Grubhub to get delivery to the hotel, and the next day on my way out of town to return home I stopped again for more! Great food great service and even though they were busy when I stopped in the line and food moved very fast!

cxNPDFG7alvLPLufgvJOAA.text: BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!  STAFF RUDE!   Sunday night (02/26/2017 6:14 pm) at your store.  Order a 6 inch pizza; after seeing customers who came in after me. Leave out with their order; ask cashier what happen to me order. The responds, " I don't know."  Oh, your pizza was dropped.  Ok, when were they going to tell me????  WOW!!!!  Then you think they would have made my pizza first, right???  NO!!! WOOW.......and still was not making my order.  Well, I sat down thinking they would make make my order.  After another person left out; I just ask for my money back.  When trying to get the money back; the person who was taking the pizza out of the oven....................did not have a clue what was going on with the order!!!! Guess what....still have not make my pizza!!!  WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!     That was a big fail with your staff on customer service; may be if the pizza maker was not joking around and laughing he would not have dropped the pizza.  Served with Love......NOT AT THIS LOCATION!!!!!!!

7pW_XxVm1ZckWgEd2flGAQ.text: I stumbled upon this restaurant the other day and I'm so happy I did the pizza here is really great I love the crust the salad is also very good I came here twice in a row

TTrGyQAZR2_EP3cNIuw4QQ.text: Seriously AWESOME pizza and OUTSTANDING service! We had a gluten free vegan pizza and I can honestly say... It was the best I've EVER had. My friend is actually allergic (vice preference) and they actually made our pizza at separate  station! If you're allergic...then you know how impressive and important that is. The crust was tasty and crispy... Ingredients super fresh. You MUST try this place.... GF, Vegan or just a pizza connoisseur!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sooo yummo! GF crust, faith cheese, tomato, red onion, spinach and broccoli

5WNQinkbk48ci-XwZC469g.text: I'm only writing this review b/c it's the second time this week the customer service has been on pist ! But I will only discuss today b/c I hate liars. So my big pregnant Axx orders a kid meal online @12:10 they said it will be ready @12:40 I get there purposely @ 12:45 b/c Tuesday when I went the food order wasn't ready until 10 minutes after I got there. So anyways I go to the counter the skinny girl with the bun asks the other girl to give her my orde she says it's not here. She then asks the rude ass pizza artist (the guy responsible for making pizza) & he snaps and say I made ever order up there...she comes back & says it should be done in a few minutes it's coming down the line okay cool...it wasn't until I waited 13 minutes & noticed it's not coming down the line the two people behind me were getting salads & then the pizza artist ain't making shxx I then ask for a refund she goes it's done now. A whole lie ! B/c they not boxing any pizza & I didn't see shxx coming down the line....in conclusion I got a refund & left...but my whole thing is say I'm sorry for the inconvenience, apologies we got behind & missed the order something... people order online for the convenience...smh

snd0304pHvg8uolXl3wH4A.text: They were awesome , even when my brother accidentally spilled his drink. One of the workers joked with my mom as he cleaned it up. My mom got two free kids pizza for free ( Sunday special) idk how but she said don't question it. The pizza was delicious and I'm craving another pizza & salad. The restaurant is cute and very clean, I also love the vegan options they have.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States. Their promise to all customers
Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States. They have usb outlets!
Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States. My veggie pizza, yum!!

Zud91MNjGWQpJf5vjK_1Ww.text: The pizza is so delicious. My favorite is their steak and blue cheese pizza with balsamic vinegar. And the staff is always great, tonight the sweetest ladies were working and just made the experience that much better!!

3YS9sv04RAhEgZKysV9AsA.text: Went in for lunch so needless to say I didn't have too much time to spare.  I ordered the BBQ chicken chef made pizza and it was not what I expected.  I have been craving this type of pizza for a while and really anticipated it but I when I saw it I was so disappointed on seeing onions on my pizza which was NOT advertised.  I HATE onions and If i would've saw it I would've left it out as I did the corn.  I did not have time to get another pizza made so I didn't say anything.  Not sure if I'll try them again.

dFKNZRemudLlMLj_L9FDmw.text: I'm a fan! I wasn't too excited to see another pizza place in Charlotte but this is my new favorite. They assemble the pizza in front of you and then bake it there. The pizza is really tasty and my stomach is growling as I write this review! Tons of options for toppings and I like the wheat crust, although they also have traditional and gluten free. I brought my picky 9 year old niece and she loved the pepperoni pizza. The Maddio special is around $8 and is a great deal--small pizza (it is very small but filling), side salad and drink. The Greek side salad was delicious and a good serving. The cookies are huge and delicious. Staff is very nice and friendly.

mGVImKRLx45bb00LSl-B5Q.text: Not a fan of this place.  The pizza tasted like a bad frozen pizza.

BCZ4IwpvpoQ3ljt8MgSS7A.text: Not what we expected (it's a chain, not family owned?) the serving sizes are really big so we were able to split an individual pizza between the two of us. Since it was Monday it was a special and came with a drink. The pizza was surprisingly really good! They have a lot of options that most pizza places don't offer and a large dining area.

plnaRJydsvsvQbI5yfz3tQ.text: I have Celiac Disease, so I love a place that I can rely upon not to get me sick. The gluten free pizza here is delicious! My only complaint is that it only comes in a small size.

ieEzZrScbM2eSRVH0-x2HA.text: Excellent pizza, great sauce- the salad was fresh with good dressing, fast and friendly service.

e9B_9nqXfXc0U-p2ad6mMw.text: The pizza here is really good, as are the canolis. The flavor, the sauce, the cheese, the crust...just took me way back to Brooklyn. My daughter and I really enjoyed the pizza and have had pleasant experiences each time we've been here. I have no complaints, only compliments. Keep it up Maddio's! We'll be back!

ZoZrGgNeDg1L1-5WIf_V-A.text: This review is really not for the pizza, because it's delicious. I am real disappointed in this Uncle Maddio's franchise. I signed up for the member rewards program. I was excited last week to get a text and email from them about a 10" special they had (2 for $9.50). I hopped in my car to take advantage of it. I wasted my time and gas coming here. As soon as I pulled up, I saw a sign in a window that said this location is not participating in this particular special. Then I went inside and there was another sign with the same notification. I talked to a young lady behind the counter and she confirmed, telling me the owner wasn't going to honor this special. Dammit I want my gas money back and time! If you are going to text me and email me, at least put a clause in there that says all franchises do not participate and you may want to call and confirm before wasting your time. I'm pulling my rewards membership and not going back.

zE7Y_2JZSrjMqUCPVrWcIg.text: Very fresh ingredients. Staff is very friendly. Their pizzas are delicious. I love the steak and bleu.

BiXcfVaUwpCzIUSpH-xOdg.text: Service was great. Rashod was friendly and helpful. They have a gluten free menu and real silverware. Loved it.

q0kpT5s0eo-sfMeyUt_Opg.text: I got a build your own (garlic olive oil, tomato, spinach, feta, balsamic glaze). My new favorite. Yummmm.

FnqjS2GGOoKI7usTI4rzOw.text: Great for the kids on Sundays. Kids eat free and can't beat the price. 20 dollars any topping and 2 kids pizzas

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States

o7wxVebGr_v_FPhsB03V_g.text: Really great! Looking for a local place to eat and was very happy! I had the peach special and it was very different and great tasting

ufTw1t60TdkcuO6s_Nsxfg.text: I came her for the special they had. It was $3 for a one topping pizza. It was a decent pizza. I like how you can choose what you would like. They are personal pizzas which I enjoy as well as it being a thin crust. I think it adds a crunch and crispiness.

CxRB60_e82CdmFnkxSgaNg.text: Kids eat free on every Sunday. The staff is friendly and courteous. The food is good and the restaurant is clean.  Great place for a family lunch, especially with toddlers/young children.

At3GNFT5UHq9L1MrRodX1A.text: Don't bother ordering online. You'll wait extra long. Order 10 minutes before going on. Went to pick up order and it wasn't even started. 5 people got their pizza before me but ordered after me. I'll stick with Omaggio's or Blaze.

CN64oGeJvZOpgIR0og0_fg.text: Ate here with friends for lunch the first time ever. Really good.!!! I got the buffalo chicken pizza. My friends got the max & the other requested a chicken alfredo with spinach & mushrooms. Looked really good! We left full & happy. Edit: just ate here again 2-2-18 I got the 4 cheese pizza & added pepperoni... Really good & their salads look amazing! Also they have vegan options as well

sNARaVSJ8T92OnMnMHRSGA.text: Although the make your own pizza style place is a relatively new concept, I've visited quite a few of them and Uncle Maddio's is definitely one of my top 3. Delicious pizzas, friendly employees always patient with how indecisive I can be sometimes. The wheat crust is healthier and tastes just as good as a regular pizza so it's nice that they have it when most other places do not. Always a nice experience here and will definitely continue to come here for lunch and dinner!

KPt1ZVXjb3RLZlGmcbTkmQ.text: Love their pizzas, kinda of a jump in price from individuals to the next size but totally worth it. They give free birthday individual pizzas if you sign up for an account with them and they don't spam you with emails or anything just specials that are really worth it. Would definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States

tEFA_O01TUv36lX3_xHB2Q.text: I was excited to learned that this was a new location for Uncle Maddio's. I have not enjoyed a Santa Fe salad since I worked uptown and was able to walk to the location inside the BOA building.   The staff are still organizing the flow of orders but I was able to get my order in without any problem. Also, the cashier was super nice and the place was really clean. The Caribbean spot that used to be on the corner of this location is sorely missed, but I gladly welcome good pizza and good salads any day of the week!!   Definitely a returning customer...

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States. Santa Fe Salad (comes with bacon)

3NZ2JinOenOEeDDc3gpRCQ.text: This is the place to be on a Monday, it's a bit more cheap for a whole meal! Pizza is always fresh and they always make it and your taste. You say it, they do it. Fresh pizza at your fingertips.

nkUqkz-nMu67_IGaT48tyg.text: The whole staff is amazing here i come like once or twice a month get the same thing and it slap no other mane ! They're respectful and sanitary i enjoy my visit everytime.

MhmYEhXFErcPBCHcgrMlXQ.text: Uncle Maddio's is such a great find! Quick, tasty, and allows everyone in the family to get something that they like.  Uncle Maddio's takes a fast-casual approach to pizza and salads. They offer interesting menu options but the best route is "Build-Your-Own."  Uncle Maddio's offers so many options. They have regular crust, whole-wheat, and gluten-free options. For sauces, they have tomato basil, garlic olive oil, zesty BBQ, herb pesto, and more. The toppings list is pretty outrageous--spinach, steak, meatballs, roasted corn, baby Bella mushrooms, banana peppers, jalapenos, prosciutto, celery, broccoli, grilled tofu, green and black olives, pineapple, and more! And of course, the cheese!! Mozzarella, ricotta, fontina, goat, blue, cheddar, fresh mozzarella, and DAIYA, which makes THIS VEGAN GIRL SMILE AND SAY CHEEEESE!!   Uncle Maddio's is a super easy take-out or eat-in option for weekdays or weekends. Join the Rewards program and get great deals texted to you!

oexBGd7xgNzKHZSqPnxwog.text: Uncle Maddio's came up as the highest-rated pizza place in Charlotte on Yelp, so I was a bit disappointed to arrive and find out it's a build-your-own-pizza chain. However, I gamely built my own pizza and had an overall pleasant experience.  First off, the staff were incredibly nice and helpful. They really made me feel welcome. The pizza ingredients themselves are a bit generic, but it tasted good. I do appreciate that they have a whole wheat crust, and I added ricotta, spinach, mushrooms, and onions to make a pretty standard pizza. I thought the prices were a bit high for it not being a specialty pizza venue, but overall it was a good experience.

k4LrVwvGx73sgHZRkevscg.text: Awesome pizza, great customer service and the delivery was early!  Definitely would order from here agsin!

o3HJ4gFZllsbVhLKh7j1qQ.text: OMG my daughter has done it again! She found this little place on Yelp and we decided it was a trying day and I am so glad we did. I created my own pizza I chose prosciutto spicy sausage and bella mushrooms totally delicious. My daughter had the shop Cobb salad it was delicious as well and huge. And for my little god-daughter we ordered her the kids pizza pepperoni and she ate it all and wanted more. Though this is a chain restaurant is not very gimmicky the ingredients is are high-quality the cheese and the toppings are all great tasting. I definitely will be coming back and trying other menu items I love it when I find a great food find.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States. Created her own salad omg it was delicious

xodoT1OtQP1nFH8bWUs6Qw.text: Wow, seriously disappointed. I ordered through Postmates which is a whole other awful story in its own but the pizza took over an hour. And to make it worse, it was cold and tasted god awful by the time it finally got to me. I got sick within the same hour I attempted to eat one slice. Definitely a never again type of situation for me. YUCK.

DWKs7JqQMVAN2Nr-khSIaA.text: I ordered an individual sized pizza with three toppings. I love that they have so many options, you are limited to how many you get before you get charged extra. I thought the price was fair for the location. It took around 10 minutes, the staff were super friendly. I got my pizza carry out but the restaurant looked cleaned! The pizza was decent - it wasn't my favorite. I have had better, but I still give it four stars. I would go back if I didn't have many options to choose from, but it wouldn't be my first choice!

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States

awPHJFaLSmeYAaWV81TeVg.text: This is another go to pizza joint in Charlotte! I got two different pies delivered to me using the DoorDash app and it was worth every penny. I was worried about the size but the pizzas, but they were very filling and tasted amazing. If your a cheese lover I recommend getting the fresh mozzarella, it will take your pizza to another level. Each bite is loaded with toppings, just how pizza is supposed be.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States

s2FUiWitC2Bvf5s_BGxilA.text: Salad was boring and the pizza was really nothing to talk about...had no flavor and was over cooked

gedgiyIziafImyDr1N3HUg.text: HORRIBLE SERVES. Employees are miserable. Food took way to long to prepare! Stood in line for 15 mins just waiting for our order to be taken! Good is always good but need to hire some people that like their job & WANT TO DO THEIR JOB !

U6e5MDSlX-8v9tIiZu2-Ww.text: Amazing gluten free crust ! I first ordered Uncle Maddio's Pizza from Door Dash and was very impressed . Their toppings were fresh with a hint of what seemed like lemon juice- ah the little things. The second time I dined in and struck up a conversation with the manager. I've tried many gluten free crusts and told him this one had a certain quality you don't find at many other places. Come to find out the GF crust is sourced locally from Charlotte, NC . Ah, the little things made a big difference for this foodie! I'll definitely be back.

bGj_EBQoCTRkIQh5ibYnAw.text: How did this place get as good a ratings as it did!!  With that said it's not bad it's just not good. I've had better tasting frozen pizzas. I got the kids meal cheese pizza to test it out. Let's just say I wasnt wanting another.   The sauce tasted similar to little Cesar's and thick. The crust had hard corn meal on it and it just wasn't that good. Cheese was the better part of the pizza.   Will I be back? ..probably not. 3 stars because I was able to eat it.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States. Not great cheese pizza. If I was starting with no other choice, I would come back. I&#39;ve had better frozen pizzas.
Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pizza to go box
Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States. Where they ring your order up

JJe1akCToscj-yZi5XQL6g.text: While spending time with a family member in the hospital I ordered a pizza. When it arrived at the hospital the driver handed me the pizza box dripping from the edges. The pesto sauce leaked all through the box all over the pizza. He hands me a bunch of napkins and says "wow sorry bout' that" and leaves. We tried to eat what we could of the pizza but it was soggy and did not taste good. No refund, No nothing. Bad business don't order anything from this place. They don't care about customers.

U2YSY2k6-uULT5vqrCVrCQ.text: They can't handle a busy lunch rush. They even locked their doors at 12:45 on Tuesday 8/27/19 during the Charlotte lunch rush because they got a "big" 17 pizza order. I will not go back because they locked their doors and said they would be closed for 30 minutes to "catch up".

b4kjtE_-Pvttp6OXk0IRaQ.text: I'm a big fan of make your own pizza joints, aka the Chipotle of the Italian world, and Uncle Maddio's is a good one.   Sometimes I have too difficult of a time picking toppings myself, but that's okay because I really like their Italian on the signature menu (tomato basil sauce, mozzarella, spicy Italian sausage, red onions, mushrooms, banana peppers, fresh basil). I love that there's a whole wheat crust option (they also have gluten free). They also have calzones and build your own salads. Want to make it quick? You can place your order online ahead of time.   Make sure to sign up for their rewards program. You get a free pizza just for enrolling (must use within 24 hours) and you get one point per entree purchased. Ten points will get you a free entree.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Italian

IOlJ_csOMeqzfAg56mkXUw.text: Delicious! Great customer service!! They have gluten free options and a free pizza club. Monday's are a great day to go for a 6.99 meal not including drink. The pizza tasted fresh, not greasy, with lots of flavor. My favorite is the supreme and  the Jamaican jerk was good with flavor. The to go bags were a hit with me as I do not like the waste of card board boxes after you eat your pizza.

Cfz_DkW2lqreW7bXuz9zzg.text: Checked out this place after realizing that Your Pie closed :( I love the concept of making your own pizza, and am always trying to find a place that offers whole wheat crust (what, trying to feel slightly less terrible after crushing a whole pizza) and Uncle Maddio's offers both!   I love the variety of fresh toppings that you can add to your own pizza, really truly making your own creation! If you're not feeling that adventurous, they also have "pre-made" creations that sounded equally delicious. They also have make your own Stromboli, which isn't something other pizza places in the area offer, along with wings and other menu items.   Overall, I was impressed with their efficiency, topping choices, amount of toppings they use on your pizza and the overall taste. It's definitely being added to our pizza night spots and we will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States. My veggie with procuttio pizza
Photo of Uncle Maddio's Pizza Joint - Charlotte, NC, United States. My husbands spicy meats pizza with artichokes

s41YC_gLFr234PHT3Om98Q.text: My husband and I are new to town and unfortunately had a bad experience with Maddio's pizza. We ordered pizza and the picture below is how it was delivered. We called the pizza place to let them know, and the manager told us "he didn't do it" and there was nothing they could do since they use a third party delivery service. If you choose to use a delivery service, you should care how your food is delivered. And, if you don't, you should at least care about having disappointed customers and do what you can to make it right. Very unfortunate! Won't be back.

TCxSL2x4W5OFEnLai0-jfg.text: Love this concept of being able to watch your pizza and salad be built. Reasonable prices, fresh ingredients and friendly staff! They have a gluten free option for crust and a dairy free option for cheese for those with food sensitivities. Would definitely come back!

14JfOJAKDUb_0S-9scqBkA.text: Pretty mediocre pizza. If you're in a hurry, and don't have too discerning of a palate, it'll probably do.

TH22Y2LBivCJIBM0avVdLA.text: I've here twice this week and I can say that consistency is a strong point. The ingredients are fresh and the staff is very attentive. I've had the pizza and a salad so far but I'm looking forward to trying more menu items! I wish they had more locations!   Good job!

2Z-2SzXjdA_R-g1rzzzceQ.text: . I ordered the Italian. Meh just ok. There were very few toppings. The sauce was pretty good though

RN9zInCLrSW5D_LAi4J7Qg.text: Good quality pizza as all ways. The glutten free option is refreshing and leave you feeling bloated.

TOOIkbZa7F_bc4Qcs23mVA.text: I know there are a ton of these made to order "make your own pizza" places around town, but I have to say this chain (and location specifically) always brings their A-game!  Although some of the staff may not be the most engaging, their quality sure makes up for it.  My favorite premade combination they have is the 4 cheese - Garlic Olive Oil - Ricotta - Fresh & Shredded Mozzarella - Fontina - Italian Seasoning! Get a side of marinara for dipping and you're set!  If you're a meat lover and not wanting to decide on toppings, you must got with the Big Maxx - Tomato Basil Sauce - Mozzarella - Pepperoni - Italian Sausage - Bacon - Handmade Meatballs. It's a meat lovers delight!  If you're looking for something a little more unique I'd go with the BBQ Chicken. You're probably thinking that seems kind of basic or mainstream, but they spice it up just right and make it their own! It's all inclusive of Zesty BBQ & Tomato Basil Sauce - Mozzarella & Cheddar Cheese - Grilled Chicken - Bacon - Red Onion - Roasted Corn - Cilantro!  Of course you still have the option to make your own and do it up just as you'd like... But beware at this chain your toppings aren't endless. I can't remember if it's 3 or 5 toppings max, but that includes the cheese. Because of that I typically stick with the premade options because they are absolutely delicious... Why mess with a good thing?!

gKV5Pjhhd8nQGtWdFiB7UQ.text: This place is not even worth my one star...Tonight my husband got a jamaican jerk pizza which he ordered online. When he reached at the 345 S Kings Dr, Charlotte location, the pizza wasn't even ready then the guy that was preparing the pizza, started asking my husband what's the next ingredient to put on the pizza - he did not even know to make pizza, excuse me? When the pizza arrived home, half of the ingredients and seasonings were missing - to add the frustration, the dough was really nasty.neing a regular customer, today's pizza wasn't close to the jamaican jerk chicken pizza uncle maddios is known for..I would never step back in that place or recommend anyone..worse customer service too. The service had already started going downhill few months back but now with the food quality suffering it brings an end to our patronage. Highly dissatisfied!!!!! And one last thing, what ever happen to the maddios greeting? Management should be ashamed of putting together such an inferior quality product along with disinterested and untrained staff.

wY2DPR4pSfXxjh96DYcJ1w.text: The pizza is alright but overpriced for what you get. I'm not a big fan of places that have specialty pizzas that are made incorrectly. If you're going to offer a buffalo chicken pizza then make it like a traditional buffalo chicken. The cheese breadsticks were tasty but again, they were just average.

j3fSFjys6eCjGpmhHWhbhQ.text: So good! Buffalo chicken pizza is the best. And the employees at this location are so nice

1lSTAlWP7Txc0nl1iBkUhw.text: This place is amazing! Great pizza and salads . Customer service is always the best.. Recently visited when they had a sign stating to be patient as they have new employees. You would never know! Everyone there is top notch! One of our favorite lunchtime places at work.

dYcrP_iPqqpZTB0oTp3rBg.text: Good pizza. Terrible customer service experience!!!  I typically order from the location on Tryon - I've had no issues there. But this location - the service was absolute terrible.   While i stood and waited on my to-go order, I observed an elderly couple sitting at a table. An employee brought a box (or possibly a to-go order) to their table. Rather than a offer pleasant "here you go" and handing them the box, the employee literally dropped the box on the table and walked away, without saying a word or making eye contact.  The woman at the table was visibly offended (as was I for her). The woman couldn't say anything because the employee was back in the kitchen by then.  About 10 min later, I was waiting for my name or my type of pizza to be called to signify that it was ready to pick up. As I expected to get a verbal call for my order, I decided to browse my phone. Suddenly, without any verbal notification at all, I saw a pizza box flung in my direction. It somewhat startled me - it was the same employee holding my pizza box without making any eye contact. It was as though she was "over the entire night and could care less about being pleasant or efficient at her job."   I reached out to get the box (expecting a "have a nice night")...but instead....SILENCE as she walked away). It was extremely disrespectful. I decided to just leave with my order.   I know this happened to at least one other customer and I suspect neither she nor I was the first or last to experience this kind of poor customer service that day.  I hope Maddio's has a refresher on common decency with its employees.

JKRMuYvJ4RcVFnKhASVjRg.text: Wings were .  Sorry I thought I ordered bbq wings.    Just Don't sale wings if it's horrible. DONT BUY WINGS FROM HERE
